summary: Web-based inventory management application for Bho Creation clothing manufacturing company. Track fabric stock using barcode scanning (via device camera). Features: role-based authentication (Master Admin, Office Staff, Workers), individual user accounts with ID/password, fabric inventory management with add/remove/deduct quantities, complete audit trail tracking who added/removed fabrics, real-time data sync across all users. Admin panel for user management and permission assignment. Email-based password reset for office staff. Mobile-responsive design for phone/desktop browsers.
architectural_notes: Cloud backend needed for multi-user sync (Firebase or similar)
Web application built with React + TypeScript frontend and Motoko backend on Internet Computer
Device camera integration for barcode scanning in web browsers
Mobile-responsive design for phone and desktop browsers
Three-tier role hierarchy: Master Admin > Office Staff > Workers
Image storage and retrieval system needed for fabric photos and bill receipts
known_issues: Platform limitation: Cannot build Android native apps or generate Android Studio code
Previous build attempts failed due to Android/web platform mismatch

existing_features.title: Implement user authentication system allowing users to create accounts with username and password, log in, and maintain separate inventory data per user account

Create an inventory dashboard view displaying all fabrics with their details: fabric type, rack location (barcode), and available quantity in meters, updated in real-time as stock changes

Design a professional and intuitive user interface with a modern, clean aesthetic suitable for an industrial inventory management application, using a warm, professional color palette (avoid blue and purple) and clear typography for readability in a warehouse environment

Create a Master Admin panel that allows the Master Admin to view all users, create new user accounts with unique ID and password, assign roles (Master Admin, Office Staff, Worker), and manage user permissions

Implement a complete audit trail system that logs every inventory change with details: who performed the action (user ID/name), what action was taken (added/removed fabric, quantity deducted), which fabric was affected, timestamp of the change, and previous/new values

Ensure all inventory data synchronizes in real-time across all active user sessions so that when any user updates inventory data (adds fabric, deducts quantity, removes entry), all other logged-in users see the changes immediately without needing to refresh
